sd:service.dc:title: Related annotation
sd:service.sd:serviceLabel: Add linked annotations to this object

sd:service.dc:title: Twitter
sd:service.dc:description: Find related URLs in Twitter
sd:service.sd:serviceLabel: Link to related URLs in Twitter

sd:service.dc:title: Twitter
sd:service.dc:description: Add related URL in Twitter

sd:service.dc:title: Related subjects
sd:service.dc:description: Find related subjects based on occurrences in the same records

sd:service.dc:title: Hungarian authors
sd:service.dc:description: Hungarian authors

sd:service.dc:title: SZTAKI Dictionary
sd:service.dc:description: SZTAKI Dictionary

sd:service.dc:title: KB resolver
sd:service.dc:description: KB resolver

sd:service.dc:title: Google maps
sd:service.dc:description: Locate position directly on Google maps

sd:service.dc:title: Geonames
sd:service.dc:description: Locate on map with Geonames

sd:service.dc:title: Google books
sd:service.dc:description: Link to Google books and search for OCLC number

sd:service.dc:title: Show PDF
sd:service.dc:description: This service is specificallly used for the Dutch Newspapers collection. The identifier or a newspaper article is used as input for a regular expression to display the PDF of the whole news paper in PDF. This SID is a workaround until the collection is in production.

sd:service.dc:title: Suggestions
sd:service.dc:description: The output of a text analyser service is trasformed to an HTML window with search suggestions.

sd:service.dc:title: Show SGD text
sd:service.dc:description: XSLT transformation of XML text of pages from Dutch Parliamentary Papers with highlighting of search terms. Parameters for image file and coordinates file are obtained from the url of the image url. This is an example of a work around for wrong metadata.

sd:service.dc:title: Show DNP articles
sd:service.dc:description: XSLT transformation of XML text of articles from Dutch Newspapers with highlighting of search terms. Parameters for image file and coordinates file are obtained from dc:identifier via a regular expression.

sd:service.dc:title: Service Integration Descriptions
sd:service.dc:description: Search services in the TEL service integration description registry for a specific field name.

sd:service.dc:title: VIAF identities
sd:service.dc:description: Search identity in VIAF

sd:service.dc:title: Co-authors
sd:service.dc:description: Find related authors based on occurrences in the same records

sd:service.dc:title: Map timeline
sd:service.dc:description: Use the complete list of search results as input to display on Google maps with a timeline. The records need to contain date and geographical coordinates.

sd:service.dc:title: Amazon book search
sd:service.dc:description: Search book in Amazon via ISBN

sd:service.dc:title: Analyse text
sd:service.dc:description: Analyse text and extract named entities and display as fields for further navigation.
sd:service.sd:serviceLabel: Search suggestions based on statistical text analysis

sd:service.dc:title: Google translate
sd:service.dc:description: Translates from source to destination language. Because the number of language pairs is very big there is no check on a language pair being supported. The translated field is shown as an alert message leaving the original field unchanged. The length is restricted to 256 characters.

sd:service.dc:title: Google translate
sd:service.dc:description: Translates from source to destination language and replaces the original field. The length is restricted to 256 characters. Because the number of language pairs is very big there is no check on a language pair being supported.

sd:service.dc:title: Old maps
sd:service.dc:description: Search via SRU for historical maps containing a geographical point. Extra parameters are the brief and full format. These parameters are currently considered extraElements because they are not needed in this specific case.
sd:service.sd:serviceLabel: Find old maps with this location

sd:service.dc:title: Geonames
sd:service.dc:description: Service that takes a placename as input and produces a list of related places.

sd:service.dc:title: Geonames
sd:service.dc:description: Service that searches most relevant cities within a bounding box in Geonames
Service that finds the most relevant places within a bounding box.

sd:service.dc:title: Google Dictionary
sd:service.dc:description: Google dictionary

sd:service.dc:title: Getty
sd:service.dc:description: Search in Getty thesaurus

sd:service.dc:title: Flickr
sd:service.dc:description: Flickr search

sd:service.dc:title: Youtube
sd:service.dc:description: Search video's for subject or author in Youtube.

sd:service.dc:title: Freetranslation
sd:service.dc:description: Translation by Freetranslation. The supported language combinations are not checked. This description needs to be updated with a lookup table.

sd:service.dc:title: Google fulltext
sd:service.dc:description: This is meant for searching in Google fulltext but only displaying result if a certain text string occurs in the HTML indicating the availability of fulltext. This "screen scrape" is likely to be replaced by version based on the Google API.
sd:service.sd:serviceLabel: Display when fulltext is available in Google

sd:service.dc:title: TEL OpenURL server
sd:service.dc:description: Link to the OpenURL resolver of The European Library.

sd:service.dc:title: KB SFX server
sd:service.dc:description: Link to the OpenURL resolver of the Koninklijke Bibliotheek, national library of the Netherlands

sd:service.dc:title: Highlight query
sd:service.dc:descripton: Highlight words in an image based on the coordinates of the words in the image. Syntax: img=the image;coords=file with coodinates;format=format of the coordinates (SGD or ALTO);color=color of highlight;scale=scale factor between coordinates and image resoltion. The image and coordinates files are in this case (ANP collection) obtained from a file with structural metadata (MPEG21 DIDL). The API for requesting the components is such that the reference for the image and coordinates file can be constructed by adding an extra parameter to the identifier.
sd:service.sd:serviceLabel: Show image with query terms highlighted

sd:service.dc:title: Zoom service
sd:service.sd:serviceLabel: Display image object with zoom functionality
sd:service.dc:description: Service that an image and crops to a specified window domensions. Parameters are winWidth:ww, winHeight:wh, width:w, height:h, scale:s. Automatic integration is restricted to fit the image in a window. Complete zoom functionality requires either hardcoding or an extra service providing the user interaction.

sd:service.dc:title: Elsevier Frontpage image
sd:service.dc:description: Thumbnails with front pages images from Elsevier journals are obtained from Elsevier with ISSN substituted in the URL when the publisher field contains the text 'Elsevier'.

sd:service.dc:title: Amazon Frontpage image
sd:service.dc:description: Get thumbnails from front pages from books in Amazon based on ISBN.

sd:service.dc:title: Cepstral Text to Speech
sd:service.dc:description: Service that converts text to speech in different languages. For using this service one has to ask the owner of this service for permission.

sd:service.dc:title: Google images
sd:service.dc:description: Google image search

sd:service.dc:title: Highlight SGD images
sd:service.dc:descripton: Highlight words in an image based on the coordinates of the words in the image. Syntax: img=the image;coords=file with coodinates;format=format of the coordinates (SGD or ALTO);color=color of highlight;scale=scale factor between coordinates and image resoltion. The image and coordinates are usually obtained from a file with structural metadata (MPEG21 DIDL or METS). This description is meant for the Dutch Parliamentary Papers.

sd:service.dc:title: Babelfish
sd:service.sd:serviceLabel: Translate to prefered language by Babelfish
sd:service.dc:description: Translate field contents by Babelfish and replace the original contents. The possible language combinations are specified in a lookup table. The global variable _userLang639_1 has to be substituted by the user language and the global variable _srcLang639_1 has to be substituted by the source language both in ISO-639-1 format. For more information see http://babelfish.yahoo.com

sd:service.dc:title: Check annotation
sd:service.dc:description: Check if there are annotations for a specific object via an HTTP request. The result is an RDF response. The number of annotations is obtained from the numer of occurences of the a:annotates tag.
sd:service.sd:serviceLabel: Check for annotations for this object

sd:service.dc:title: Check annotation
sd:service.dc:description: Check if there are annotations for a specific object via a JSON request. The output is only the number of hits and the unitName.
sd:service.sd:serviceLabel: Check for annotations for this object

sd:service.dc:title: Image annotation
sd:service.dc:description: View existing image annotations in TEL database without login and without posibility to annotate.

sd:service.dc:title: Image annotation
sd:service.dc:description: Create an annotation for images. In this sid the TEL login service is accessed which does the redirect to the annotation service. Optional parameters are geographical coordinates for map annotation, which allow visualisation on Google maps. Other communities that want to use this annotation service should contact The European Library office for details.
